alert.note: Alert for Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 9:43PM EST until February 27 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers... Scioto River at Circleville. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Scioto River at Circleville. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Flooding may affect businesses near Mill and Canal Roads, as well as Island road and State Route 762. Backwater flooding along Big Darby Creek causes flooding of some low lying roads. The city of Circleville itself is not affected until a stage near 30 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Wednesday was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.9 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
